thread.title: Needham man goes missing, dies on Vt. snowboarding trip
thread.title_full: Needham man goes missing, dies on Vt. snowboarding trip - The Boston Globe

author: bostonglobe
title: Needham man goes missing, dies on Vt. snowboarding trip
text:
Google+
By Maddie Kilgannon Globe Correspondent February 14, 2017
A 22-year-old Needham man who went missing while snowboarding at Vermont’s Stowe Mountain Resort on Monday has died, officials said.
Brett Cohen, who was a senior at the University of Vermont, was with a friend in a wooded area off of a trail when the two got separated, according to Stowe police chief Donald Hull. Cohen’s friend reported him missing at 3:30 p.m.
Advertisement
Ski patrol began to search for Cohen, and they were then joined by Stowe Mountain Rescue, Vermont State Police Search and Rescue, Waterbury Backcountry Rescue, Colchester Technical Rescue, the Stowe Police Department, and Mt. Mansfield Ski Patrol, Hull said.
Cohen was found in a wooded area, partially buried in snow at 11:30 p.m., Hull said. He was unresponsive when rescue crews found him, and he was taken to the UVM Medical Center where was pronounced dead Tuesday morning, Hull said.
Maddie Kilgannon can be reached at maddie.kilgannon@globe.com . Follow her on Twitter @MaddieKilgannon .
